Gordon Mohr <gojomo@...> writes:

> On 4/24/13 11:55 AM, phillip.lord@... wrote:
>>
>> I am trying to understand the crawl scope a little better.
>> I have the following setp up in my crawler-beans.cxml. Now, my thought
>> was that this would restrict the crawl to URLs which have are prefixed
>> with one of the seeds that I have declared earlier.
>>
>> However, the crawl does check outgoing links also. Again, from the
>> documentation, it seemed to me that this should only happen if
>> alsoCheckVia was true, in which case URLs directly referenced would be
>> from a URL prefixed with a seed would also be crawled.
>>
>> Have I misuderstood?
>>
>> I am running heritrix 3.1.1.
>
> Any of the rules that appear after the early SurtPrefixedDecideRule 
> could also set the scoping decision to ACCEPT.
>
> The main other reason such extra ACCEPTs are done, in our default case 
> for usual archival collection, is *transclusion*. That is, another URI 
> is referred to in a way that makes the crawler believe this other URI is 
> (or is likely) needed to accurately redisplay the page later.
>
> Most commonly, this is as the SRC attribute of an IMG, IFRAME, SCRIPT, 
> or LINK element (but also includes URIs inferred from inside Javascript, 
> where it is hard to tell if they are used for in-page updates or as 
> separate navigation targets).
>
> If you don't need to fetch such resources, you can discard the 
> TransclusionDecideRule, or (equivalently) set its various 
> hops-to-respect-such-inclusion settings to '0'.
>
> This is also addresses somewhat at:
>
> https://webarchive.jira.com/wiki/display/Heritrix/unexpected+offsite+content

Ah, of course, thank you, that helps very much indeed!

Phil
